title: The Practice of Forgiveness
subtitle: Free yourself from what they did
description: Forgiveness isn't about them—it's about you. It's not condoning what happened or letting someone back in. It's releasing the grip that resentment has on your life. This course guides you through real forgiveness, including the hardest kind: forgiving yourself.

modules.title: What Forgiveness Actually Is
modules.description: And what it isn't—clearing up the confusion

modules.title: Why Forgiveness Matters
modules.description: The cost of holding on to resentment

modules.title: Feeling the Pain First
modules.description: You can't forgive what you haven't fully felt

modules.title: The Forgiveness Process
modules.description: A practical path to letting go

modules.title: Forgiving Yourself
modules.description: The hardest and most important forgiveness

modules.title: Living Forgiven
modules.description: What's possible when you're no longer carrying it

whatYouLearn: Understand what forgiveness is and isn't
See clearly the cost of unforgiveness
Feel and process the original pain
Forgive yourself for your own mistakes
Live without the weight of resentment
requirements: Someone or something to forgive (including yourself)
Willingness to feel pain before releasing it

questions.question: What is forgiveness NOT?
options: Condoning what happened or letting the person back in

questions.question: Why does unforgiveness hurt you more than the other person?
options: You carry the resentment in your body and psyche; they've often moved on

questions.question: Why is feeling the pain important before forgiving?
options: You can't truly release what you haven't fully acknowledged and felt

questions.question: Why is forgiving yourself often the hardest?
options: You know all your thoughts and motivations, and can't hide from yourself
You don't need to forgive yourself

questions.question: What becomes possible when you've truly forgiven?
options: Freedom—your energy is no longer tied to the past
